DOC.brief_summary: In trial investigator aim establish whether Emotional Freedom Techniques ( EFT ) reduce cognitive complaint cancer survivor . All consent patient age 18 year , diagnose solid tumour hematologic malignancy complete late phase chemotherapy , radiotherapy , anti-hormonal targeted therapy treatment , participate trial . Patients suffer subjective cognitive complaint base score 43 Cognitive Failure Questionnaire ( CFQ ) . These patient randomly assign either control intervention group . Patients intervention group schedule receive 8-week EFT intervention program . Other patient place 8-week wait list patient also start EFT program .
DOC.brief_title: Emotional Freedom Techniques Intervention Strategy Reduce Patient Reported Cognitive Complaints Cancer Survivors
DOC.criteria: Patients reach minimum age 18 year time enrolment Histologically confirm diagnosis solid cancer hematologic malignancy Patients receive chemo radiotherapy , target therapy hormonal treatment enrollment ( active treatment antihormonal therapy brachytherapy allow ) Patients include late phase chemotherapy , radiotherapy , antihormonal targeted therapy treatment Patients treat curative intent expect life expectancy least 5 year Patients must suffer subjective cognitive complaint base Cognitive Failure Questionnaire ( cutoff â‰¥ 43 ) Patients able adequately communicate Dutch French Patients present sufficient mental physical functional status ( accord investigator 's judgment ) Patients receive treatment palliative intent Patients show sign mental deterioration Patients suffer organic brain syndrome Patients alcohol drug dependent Patients major psychiatric neurologic disorder could potentially invalidate assessment ; prior current diagnosis depressive , anxiety adjustment disorder allow
